stories.text:
I'm a business analyst doing all data work for some middle man company. Atm, I feel overwhelmed, one email after the other, demanding me to finish all the reports (all still in dev. stage for this new program). Sometimes I just stare at the screen, I couldn't even start anything. And there's constant distraction (Ms teams, more emails...).

I got assigned to this new program where I have to build all the reports from scratch. I do like building and creating but it just got to a point when it feels overwhelming.

When I found out someone else is going revamp eveyrthing I created for the old program I was handling, I felt even more demotivated. No wonder I couldn't even finish anything now.

I was promised of promotion and wage increase this quarter but now I feel like I wont be getting it as I cannot fulfill the demands anymore.
stories.title: How do I stop feeling overwhelmed at work?
